intro: Symphyotrichum regnellii, commonly known as the eastern blueweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small blue or purple daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, with a rough texture, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples.
